intro: Gamocarpha scapigera, commonly known as the scapigera thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually purple to pink in color, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Gamocarpha scapigera is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its aggressive growth habit.
